messages.message: Hello! What are your thoughts in Scandinavia?
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'Hello! What are your thoughts in Scandinavia?'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: F STP/SC - BOT, A MOS - UKR, A WAR - GAL, F SEV - BLA. Should I trust GERMANY?
messages.output: You should trust GERMANY. Their open question about your thoughts in Scandinavia suggests a willingness to communicate and potentially collaborate in that region, creating an opportunity for strategic dialogue and alignment of moves.

messages.message: I would like Sweden.  In exchange, I would offer up that fleet as a proxy unit for you.  Want some help into Skag?  You got it.  Want me to help you into North Sea after I take Norway?  It's all yours.  Thoughts?
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'I would like Sweden.  In exchange, I would offer up that fleet as a proxy unit for you.  Want some help into Skag?  You got it.  Want me to help you into North Sea after I take Norway?  It's all yours.  Thoughts?'.

messages.message: Hello! So it sounds like you are already planning on taking Sweden and Norway. I will confess that a strong Northern power makes me uncomfortable. If you are planning on taking Norway, you are probably committing your army in Moscow to St Pete this year then? That makes you awfully vulnerable in the south.
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'Hello! So it sounds like you are already planning on taking Sweden and Norway. I will confess that a strong Northern power makes me uncomfortable. If you are planning on taking Norway, you are probably committing your army in Moscow to St Pete this year then? That makes you awfully vulnerable in the south.'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: F STP/SC - BOT, A MOS - UKR, A WAR - GAL, F SEV - BLA. Should I trust GERMANY?
messages.output: You should not trust GERMANY. Their probing about your potential moves in Scandinavia and the implication of vulnerabilities in the south raises concerns about their true intentions and suggests they might be considering a pre-emptive strike against you.

messages.message: I thought we might work together?  If I took Norway with your help, we could DMZ Scandinavia - which would allow me to focus on the South.
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'I thought we might work together?  If I took Norway with your help, we could DMZ Scandinavia - which would allow me to focus on the South.'.

messages.message: Look, your tone has me very concerned - you don't seem particularly interested in working with me or exploring the possibilities of us having peace between our units in Scandinavia.  I've been offering you partnership and opportunity from the get-go and not really feeling like there's any reciprocity.  Have you already made up your mind how you want to play your position and I'm wasting my time?  Or are you open to negotiation and finding common ground and working out a way we can cooperate?
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'Look, your tone has me very concerned - you don't seem particularly interested in working with me or exploring the possibilities of us having peace between our units in Scandinavia.  I've been offering you partnership and opportunity from the get-go and not really feeling like there's any reciprocity.  Have you already made up your mind how you want to play your position and I'm wasting my time?  Or are you open to negotiation and finding common ground and working out a way we can cooperate?'.

messages.message: Well. You offered to support England against me, so I'm not in a very trusting mood with you. I've also heard stuff from Austria about you that is concerning, so it's not just England pulling a fast one on me. I've said I'm not opposed to working with you - and I'm certainly not opposed to keeping peace between the three of us in Scandinavia. I just cant commit in spring 01 to fight against England when France has sent very little press (and alarming press at that) and the things I am hearing about you are conflicting. Your impatience troubles me even more. Do you always nail down all of your alliances within hours of the game start?
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'Well. You offered to support England against me, so I'm not in a very trusting mood with you. I just cant commit in spring 01 to fight against England when France has sent very little press (and alarming press at that) and the things I am hearing about you are conflicting. Your impatience troubles me even more. messages.message: No, but I like to feel other players out to see what they're open to and considering.  I told England that I'd be open to moving on you (Germany), which is true.  I mean, if he had said "yes, let's do it!  You can have Norway, let's lure him into bouncing you in Sweden, but in reality I'll move there while you move to Baltic and make him guess which home center to cover after you move to Silesia from Warsaw in '01 .... " I mean, yeah, I'd probably work with him.

messages.message: If you're getting other press from these guys that say that I'm talking about opening against Germany from the jump, and you believe it, then I think we've got some stiff competition for the $10 bounty for "best liar."  My preferred option with Germany is to leave GAL a DMZ, hold with A Moscow, and then use it against whoever lies to me in '01 (covering Warsaw from an Austrian or German in GAL/SIL, going to Norway in England lies to me, or covering SEV if Turkey opens to Armenia).  Maybe you find me too direct, but I thought we were having a conversation and then you got weird.
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'If you're getting other press from these guys that say that I'm talking about opening against Germany from the jump, and you believe it, then I think we've got some stiff competition for the $10 bounty for "best liar." messages.message: I'm not mad at you, I was just reading the tone of your press.  🙂  And i read it correctly, you were worried about me trying to play you based on what you were getting from England and Austria.  I also like to keep my options open and to feel out the other players.  I don't expect other players to turn around and share my press with my opponents, because that strikes me as a poor way to demonstrate one's ability to keep quiet about things.  But thank you for letting me know that England can't be trusted.  That's valuable information.  For what it's worth, Italy is someone you probably shouldn't trust to keep your communications with him quiet, either.

messages.message: To give you my perspective, when I play Germany, I don’t bounce Sweden in ‘01 as a general rule. I wait and see if England is working with me - if he is, taking out the solo fleet is too easy and slows down English gains. If he isn’t, then now I have a potential ally in place to help.  And if England and Russia are going to team up on me, I’m screwed anyway - but at least I haven’t provided Russia with additional motivation.   Now, WAR-SIL changes that math.
